title: Business & Finance
text:
The U.S. economy shrank in 2020 for the first time since the financial crisis, but grew rapidly in the fourth quarter and is forecast to continue recovering.

Initial jobless claims fell last week, indicating a recent easing in the pace of layoffs, though the labor market remains mired in a winter slowdown.

---

The clash between Apple and Facebook intensified as their CEOs squared off in public remarks over privacy and other issues.

---

GM set a 2035 target date for phasing out gasoline- and diesel-powered vehicles as it plans a transition to a fully electric lineup.

---

WeWork is in talks to combine with a SPAC, a deal that would take the office-leasing firm public after its 2019 failure to stage a traditional IPO.

---

McKinsey is close to reaching a settlement with state attorneys general over advice it gave to Purdue Pharma and other opioid manufacturers.

---

U.S. stocks rose, with the S&P 500 and Dow both advancing 1% and the Nasdaq gaining 0.5%.

---

American Airlines posted an $8.9 billion loss for 2020. Southwest Airlines lost nearly $3.1 billion last year.
